TITLE_UR: دل دھڑکنے کا سبب یاد آیا
TITLE_EN: Dil Dhadakne Ka Sabab Yaad Aaya
notes: One of Kazmi's most iconic ghazals, frequently sung. The repetition of 'yaad aaya' (remembered) creates a hypnotic, reflective mood.

TITLE_UR: وہ تیری یاد تھی اب یاد آیا
TITLE_EN: Woh Teri Yaad Thi Ab Yaad Aaya
notes: A masterclass in delayed grief and remembrance, where the poet only understands the depth of his loss in retrospect.

TITLE_UR: گلی گلی میری یاد بچھی ہے
TITLE_EN: Gali Gali Meri Yaad Bichhi Hai
RHYME_PATTERNS: AA BA CA DA EA FA
notes: A ghazal rich with signature Kazmi imagery of night, urban landscapes, and existential wandering.

TITLE_UR: ہوا آہستہ چلو
TITLE_EN: Hawa Aahista Chalo
notes: The opening line is a classic example of Kazmi's lyrical softness and his personification of nature.

TITLE_UR: شام ہوتی ہے نہ راتیں کٹتی ہیں
TITLE_EN: Shaam Hoti Hai Na Raatein Katti Hain
notes: The contrast between the external world and internal emotional state is powerfully captured.

TITLE_UR: آؤ کچھ دیر رو ہی لیں ناصرؔ
TITLE_EN: Aao Kuch Dair Ro Hi Lein Nasir
RHYME_PATTERNS: AA BA CA DA EA FA
notes: A deeply intimate and melancholic ghazal where the poet invites his own name (Nasir) to share a moment of catharsis.

TITLE_UR: تم ہی کہو کہ کتنا سہی
TITLE_EN: Tum Hi Kaho Ke Kitna Sahi
notes: The radif 'ke liye' (for) emphasizes the search for purpose and belonging.

TITLE_UR: پھر تم تو یاد آئے
TITLE_EN: Phir Tum To Yaad Aaye
notes: The circular structure of memory is captured in the repetition of 'aaya' (came/remembered).

TITLE_UR: چاند کی زرد سی چادر
TITLE_EN: Chand Ki Zard Si Chadar
notes: The imagery of the moon's pale sheet is a perfect visual metaphor for loneliness.

TITLE_UR: یہ تیری یاد ہے یا کوئی خواب ہے
TITLE_EN: Yeh Teri Yaad Hai Ya Koi Khwab Hai
notes: The opening couplet blurs the line between memory and dream, a hallmark of Kazmi's style.

TITLE_UR: دیر سے ہے دل کو قرار آیا ہوا
TITLE_EN: Dair Se Hai Dil Ko Qarar Aaya Hua
notes: A rare moment of anticipated peace in Kazmi's usually melancholic universe.

TITLE_UR: اک خواب سا گزرا ہے
TITLE_EN: Ek Khwab Sa Guzra Hai
notes: The changing season mirrors the emotional state of the poet, creating a powerful synesthetic effect.

TITLE_UR: وہ اک ستارہ جو ٹوٹ کر بجھ گیا
TITLE_EN: Woh Ek Sitara Jo Toot Kar Bujh Gaya
notes: The falling star is a classic symbol of loss, here made deeply personal.

TITLE_UR: تم آئے تو آنکھوں میں چاندنی سی اتر آئی
TITLE_EN: Tum Aaye To Aankhon Mein Chandni Si Utar Aayi
notes: The opening line is a beautiful expression of how presence can transform one's inner world.

TITLE_UR: یوں تو بہت سی باتیں ہوئیں
TITLE_EN: Yun To Bohut Si Baatein Hui
notes: The distinction between spoken words and those that remain in the heart is a poignant insight.

TITLE_UR: رات بھر میں نے ستارے گنے
TITLE_EN: Raat Bhar Maine Sitare Gine
notes: Counting stars is a universal symbol of sleepless longing, perfectly employed here.

TITLE_UR: دل کو ترے غموں سے کچھ نسبت ہے
TITLE_EN: Dil Ko Tere Ghamon Se Kuch Nisbat Hai
notes: The idea that sorrow can be a form of connection is a deeply Kazmian thought.

TITLE_UR: یہ جو چاندنی راتیں ہیں
TITLE_EN: Yeh Jo Chandni Raatein Hain
notes: Moonlit nights are a recurring motif in Kazmi's poetry, often associated with solitude and memory.

TITLE_UR: برسوں بعد کسی کو یاد کیا
TITLE_EN: Barson Baad Kisi Ko Yaad Kiya
notes: The act of remembering after years is portrayed as both a blessing and a curse.

TITLE_UR: تم نہیں ہو تو کیا، ہو تو سا لگتا ہے
TITLE_EN: Tum Nahin Ho To Kya, Ho To Sa Lagta Hai
notes: The paradox of absence feeling like presence is masterfully captured in the opening line.

TITLE_UR: اب کے موسم میں نہ جا
TITLE_EN: Ab Ke Mausam Mein Na Ja
notes: The repetition of 'ab ke mausam mein na ja' creates a desperate, rhythmic plea.

TITLE_UR: رات بہت تھی، چاند بھی تھا
TITLE_EN: Raat Bohut Thi, Chaand Bhi Tha
notes: Despite having all the elements (night, moon, memory), peace remains elusive.

TITLE_UR: کچھ تو ہے جس کی وجہ سے
TITLE_EN: Kuch To Hai Jis Ki Wajah Se
notes: The search for the root cause of sadness is a central theme in Kazmi's work.

TITLE_UR: تم نہ آئے تو ہم سوچتے رہ گئے
TITLE_EN: Tum Na Aaye To Hum Sochte Reh Gaye
notes: The disappointment of unfulfilled expectation is explored through the theme of someone not coming.

TITLE_UR: دل کی بات کہی نہیں جاتی
TITLE_EN: Dil Ki Baat Kahi Nahin Jati
notes: The inability to express the heart's true feelings is a powerful theme of emotional repression.

TITLE_UR: بچھڑنے والے کو کبھی نہیں بھولتے
TITLE_EN: Bicharnewale Ko Kabhi Nahin Bhoolte
notes: The paradox of trying to forget while constantly remembering is explored.

TITLE_UR: کوئی تو ہے جو طے کرے
TITLE_EN: Koi To Hai Jo Tay Kare
notes: The desire for someone else to resolve internal conflict is a cry for help.

TITLE_UR: اک شخص تھا جو کبھی ملا تھا
TITLE_EN: Ek Shakhs Tha Jo Kabhi Mila Tha
notes: One person's impact can ruin or define a life - a theme of powerful connection.

TITLE_UR: وہ شخص جو بھولے سے مل گیا تھا
TITLE_EN: Woh Shakhs Jo Bhoolay Se Mil Gaya Tha
notes: Chance encounters can have the most profound and lasting effects.

TITLE_UR: کبھی کبھی یوں بھی ہوتا ہے
TITLE_EN: Kabhi Kabhi Yun Bhi Hota Hai
notes: The acceptance of life's ironies, especially the absence of someone during moments of memory.

TITLE_UR: یاد تو بہت آتے ہو
TITLE_EN: Yaad To Bohut Aate Ho
notes: The frustration of memories that don't communicate back, of a presence that is also an absence.

TITLE_UR: کون سا موسم تھا وہ
TITLE_EN: Kaun Sa Mausam Tha Woh
notes: Memory is tied to season, and the inability to recall whether flowers bloomed or leaves fell shows the confusion of grief.

TITLE_UR: کون سی بات تھی جو یاد آئی
TITLE_EN: Kaun Si Baat Thi Jo Yaad Aayi
notes: The inability to identify exactly which memory surfaces shows the unconscious nature of grief.

TITLE_UR: دکھ تو بہت ہیں مگر کہہ نہیں سکتے
TITLE_EN: Dukh To Bohut Hain Magar Keh Nahin Sakte
notes: The paradox of having too much sorrow to express it is a profound insight into emotional overwhelm.
